Comments_List: Introduction to the transport phenomena including the different approach and equations for mass transfer. Also get to know the groundwater contaminants, groundwater flow. The last part is about current membrane applications such as FO, RO and PRO. Very useful study both theoretically and practically.
I have a good grasp on the fundamental concepts of mass transfer.
Learned a lot about transport. Practiced lots of DiffiQ

Fair amount of work and exams. The pace of the course is reasonable to follow. Effective learning time in class. 

Could maybe have a small mini project during the semester that allow students to collaborate on a real problem maybe?

The course did a good job of incorporating the history of the engineering concepts.I felt the course was derivation-heavy and could of used a few more practice problems either in class or for homework.

Strengths: Course challenged the mind

Weakness: Was always pretty lost on the homework. Without the TA, I wouldn't have known where to start on them.
Yes. The way the professor taught is very easy to understand in a practical way.
For someone who has never taken a mass transfer class before, this is a great class.
